intro: Pervinca, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple. The plant is native to the Americas but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. Pervinca is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments. Its rapid growth and attractive blooms make it a popular choice for gardeners, though it can be invasive in some regions.
